meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's time for me to put on my thinking grock (get it?) and dive into the world of LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2. I've got a whole batch of reviews from those fancy critics, and I'm here to break them down with a dash of humor and a pinch of self-deprecation.

First off, let's talk about the game itself. Is it fun? Oh yeah! It's like playing with a giant LEGO set (minus the mess and endless searching for that one tiny piece). You get to play as all sorts of Marvel characters, from Iron Man to Spider-Man, and even some... questionable choices (I'm looking at you, Carnom).

But let's get real – we're here for the reviews. So, what did those critics have to say? Well, IGN gave it an 80, saying it's "constantly fun to play" (I'm starting to think they might be a bit biased towards LEGO games). GameSpot chimed in with a 70, stating that while the game is basic, its lighthearted tone makes up for it. Gaming Age went a bit higher with an 83, praising the inclusion of plenty of Marvel characters (even if some are "questionable").

Now, I know what you're thinking – what about the other critics? Well, Cheat Code Central gave it a solid 82 for its roster of over 200 characters. Vandal thought it was a great game, but didn't add much new to the formula with a score of 77. SpazioGames agreed that it's an entertaining experience, but doesn't change the LEGO formula (80). And finally, Destructoid gave it a slightly lower score of 70, saying that while it still entertains, its core mechanics are stuck in the past.

So there you have it – my take on the critics' takes. In all seriousness, LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 is a fun game that's perfect for players of all ages (yes, even adults who won't admit they play LEGO games). Just remember to set aside some time for co-op gameplay and be prepared for some cheesy humor.

That's it for now – stay grock-tastic, friends!
